main event: A 63-year-old male observed a bright silvery object in the sky while walking in Alexandria, Virginia, on October 7, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as spherical with an annulus around its circumference and approximately 600 feet long., The sighting lasted for about 50 seconds before the object disappeared rapidly., The witness estimated the distance of the object to be roughly 3 miles., It was initially stationary for about 10 seconds before it moved away., The report suggests the object might have been an illusion created by sun reflections from ice crystals or thin clouds.
witness description: 63-year-old male, Special Assistant for the Secretary of Defense, educated with a college degree in Engineering.
